Arg.V:
#!/bin/bash
function updatepk() { if [ ! -z $1 ]; then if [ -e /var/run/yum.pid ];then exit 10 fi result=`yum -y update $1 2>&1` status=$? commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: command not found"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
commandexist=`echo $result | grep -E "yum: No such file or directory"` if [ "$commandexist" != "" ]; then exit 8 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "lock /var/run/yum.pid"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "This system is not registered with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk dhclient
exit 0

#!/bin/bash

if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
islock=`echo $result | grep -E "/var/run/yum.pid: another copy is running"`
if [ "$islock" != "" ]; then exit 10 fi
isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "There was an error communicating with RHN"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi

isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "No Repositories Available to Set Up"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isnotconnected=`echo $result | grep -E "Error Class Code: 9 Error Class Info: Invalid System Credentials"` if [ "$isnotconnected" != "" ]; then exit 9 fi isscriptletfailed=`echo $result | grep -E "error:" | grep -E "scriptlet failed, exit status 255"` if [ "$isscriptletfailed" != "" ]; then exit 6 fi if [ $status -ne 0 ];then exit 7 fi fi } updatepk dhcp
exit 0

Vulnerability.Title: dhcp bug fix update
Vulnerability.Description: The Dynamic Host Configuration Protocol (DHCP) is a protocol that allows individual devices on an IP network to get their own network configuration information, including an IP address, a subnet mask, and a broadcast address. The dhcp packages provide a relay agent and ISC DHCP service required to enable and administer DHCP on a network. This update fixes the following bugs: Previously, the "systemctl start dhcpd" command incorrectly returned a zero exit status (implying success) when the dhcpd service actually failed to start. This could cause a number of applications dependent on the exit status of dhcpd to fail or not function properly. With this update, dhcpd now notifies the initialization system when it is ready, and systemctl thus correctly returns 1 in case of a service failure. As a result, the affected applications now work as expected. (BZ#1087245) Prior to this update, when a DHCPv6 server offered a client an IPv6 address that was already in use by another machine, the dhclient utility did not send a Decline message. This behavior is not compliant with the RFC 3315 standard. This bug has been fixed, and dhclient now sends a Decline message as expected. (BZ#1133465) Previously, the dhclient-script incorrectly handled SELinux context of certain files. Consequently, running the IP injection script on Hyper-V 2012 (R2) host with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7.1 guest failed in SELinux enforcing mode. The dhclient-script has been fixed, and IP injection is now successful in this scenario. (BZ#1161500) Previously, the dhclient utility generated different DHCP Unique Identifier Based on Link-layer Address Plus Time (DUID-LLT) each time it was started in stateless mode (using the "-S" option in DHCPv6 mode, not requesting an address). A patch has been applied to change this behavior, and running the "dhclient -6 -S -D LLT" command now generates a DUID-LLT only once and writes it in a file. As a result, DUID_LLT is the same for each run of dhclient in stateless mode. (BZ#1156356) Due to a regression, DHCPv6 relay agent incorrectly handled when the "lower" interface was specified (using the "-l" command-line option) before the "upper" interface (using the "-u" option). As a consequence, relaying of messages did not work. This bug has been fixed, and DHCPv6 relay agent now relays messages as expected. (BZ#1151039) Previously, the dhclient utility did not properly handle when two or more network interfaces on one machine were connected to the same subnet and at least one of them was obtaining an IP address using DHCP. As a consequence, dhclient incorrectly assumed the address being renewed was already in use by some other machine and declined it. This bug in the dhclient-script has been fixed, and dhclient now correctly renews the address in this scenario. (BZ#1116004) The Hop Limit for the Relay-forward messages sent by DHCPv6 Relay agent was set to 1, which was not compliant with RFC 3315. With this update, the Hop Limit has been correctly set to 32. (BZ#1147240) The chrony service is configured to use NTP servers received from DHCP. Prior to this update, the NetworkManager dispatcher script failed to notify the chrony service of NTP servers received from DHCP. Consequently, boot was very slow because the system was waiting for the chrony-wait service. This bug has been fixed, and chrony-wait no longer blocks the boot. (BZ#1093490) Users of dhcp are advised to upgrade to these updated packages, which fix these bugs. Note for remediation: Please disable the SELinux for RHEL 4/5 when repairing, or some rpm packages will fail to install.
